com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class Canvas.MotionEventParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Canvas.MotionEventParser
  • Enclosing class:
    Canvas

    class Canvas.MotionEventParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser for Android android.view.MotionEvent sequences, which calls the appropriate event handlers. Specifically:
    • If a android.view.MotionEvent#ACTION_DOWN is followed by one or more android.view.MotionEvent#ACTION_MOVE events, a sequence of Sprite.Dragged(float, float, float, float, float, float) calls are generated for sprites that were touched, and the final android.view.MotionEvent#ACTION_UP is ignored.
    • If a android.view.MotionEvent#ACTION_DOWN is followed by an android.view.MotionEvent#ACTION_UP event either immediately or after android.view.MotionEvent#ACTION_MOVE events that take it no further than TAP_THRESHOLD pixels horizontally or vertically from the start point, it is interpreted as a touch, and a single call to Sprite.Touched(float, float) for each touched sprite is generated.
    After the Dragged() or Touched() methods are called for any applicable sprites, a call is made to Canvas.Dragged(float, float, float, float, float, float, boolean) or Canvas.Touched(float, float, boolean), respectively. The additional final argument indicates whether it was preceded by one or more calls to a sprite, i.e., whether the locations on the canvas had a sprite on them (true) or were empty of sprites false).

    • Field Detail

      • TAP_THRESHOLD

        public static final int TAP_THRESHOLD
        The number of pixels right, left, up, or down, a sequence of drags must move from the starting point to be considered a drag (instead of a touch).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FINGER_WIDTH

        public static final int FINGER_WIDTH
        The width of a finger. This is used in determining whether a sprite is touched. Specifically, this is used to determine the horizontal extent of a bounding box that is tested for collision with each sprite. The vertical extent is determined by FINGER_HEIGHT.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FINGER_HEIGHT

        public static final int FINGER_HEIGHT
        The width of a finger. This is used in determining whether a sprite is touched. Specifically, this is used to determine the vertical extent of a bounding box that is tested for collision with each sprite. The horizontal extent is determined by FINGER_WIDTH.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • draggedSprites

        private final java.util.List<Sprite> draggedSprites
        The set of sprites encountered in a touch or drag sequence. Checks are only made for sprites at the endpoints of each drag.
